title: Authors and Citation
text: Daniel Molitor. Author, copyright holder, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Molitor D (2025). jetty: Execute R 'Docker' Context. R package version 0.2.0, http://www.dmolitor.com/jetty/, https://github.com/dmolitor/jetty.
code: @Manual{,   title = {jetty: Execute R in a 'Docker' Context},   author = {Daniel Molitor},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.0, http://www.dmolitor.com/jetty/},   url = {https://github.com/dmolitor/jetty}, }

what: Execute R in a Docker Context
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: Execute R functions code blocks within Docker container. may useful, certain circumstances, perform computation separate R process running within Docker container. package attempts achieve !

title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: Calls R function arguments code block subprocess within Docker container. Copies function arguments (necessary) subprocess copies return value function/code block. Discovers installs required packages Docker container run-time. Copies error objects back subprocess. general, error objects include stack trace Docker R process. However, example error rlang error, include full stack trace. Shows /collects standard output standard error Docker subprocess.

title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: Install jetty CRAN: install development version jetty GitHub:

what: Synchronous, one-off R processes in a Docker container
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: Use run() execute R function code block new R process within Docker container. results passed back directly local R session.

previous_headings: Synchronous, one-off R processes in a Docker container
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: desired Docker container can set via image argument, specified string standard Docker format. formats include username/image:tag, username/image, image:tag, image. default choice r-base:{jetty:::r_version()} bare-bones R image mirrors R version running locally. example, following command executed official r-base image latest version R, comes packages beyond base set installed:

previous_headings: Synchronous, one-off R processes in a Docker container
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: can pass arguments function setting args list arguments, similar base .call function. often necessary, function evaluated Docker R process access variables parent process. example, following work: :
code: mycars <- cars jetty::run(function() summary(mycars)) #> Error in (function () : object 'mycars' not found mycars <- cars jetty::run(function(x) summary(x), args = list(mycars)) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

previous_headings: Synchronous, one-off R processes in a Docker container
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: can use package child R process, caveat package must installed Docker container. ’s recommended refer explicitly :: operator, code snippet can also call library() require() work fine. example, following code snippets work equally well:

previous_headings: Synchronous, one-off R processes in a Docker container > Using packages
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: jetty also supports installing required packages runtime. example, following code fail required packages installed Docker image: However, setting install_dependencies = TRUE can tell jetty discover required packages install executing code:  Note: feature uses renv::dependencies discover required packages, won’t handle possible scenarios. particular, won’t install specific package versions (just latest version) install packages CRAN. Use care!
code: jetty::run(   {     ggplot2::ggplot(mtcars, ggplot2::aes(x = hp, y = mpg)) +       ggplot2::geom_point()   } ) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘ggplot2’ jetty::run(   {     ggplot2::ggplot(mtcars, ggplot2::aes(x = hp, y = mpg)) +       ggplot2::geom_point()   },   install_dependencies = TRUE,   stdout = TRUE )

previous_headings: Synchronous, one-off R processes in a Docker container
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: jetty copies errors child R process main R session: Although errors propagated main R session, stack trace (currently) propagated. means calling functions traceback() rlang::last_trace() won’t help.
code: jetty::run(function() 1 + "A") #> Error in 1 + "A": non-numeric argument to binary operator

previous_headings: Synchronous, one-off R processes in a Docker container
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: default, standard output error Docker subprocess printed R console. However, since jetty uses system2() execute Docker commands, can specify stdout stderr arguments passed directly system2(). example following code print series messages console: can discard output setting stdout = FALSE: see details controlling stdout stderr, check documentation .
code: jetty::run({for (i in 1:5) message(paste0("iter", i)); TRUE}) #> iter1 #> iter2 #> iter3 #> iter4 #> iter5 #> [1] TRUE jetty::run({for (i in 1:5) message(paste0("iter", i)); TRUE}, stdout = FALSE) #> [1] TRUE

previous_headings: Synchronous, one-off R processes in a Docker container
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: jetty also provides support .Rprofile .Renviron files. default, jetty search files called “.Rprofile” “.Renviron” current working directory. files exist, jetty port Docker execution environment execute code .Rprofile load environment variables .Renviron executing provided R code. .Rprofile file uses external packages, essential tell jetty install required packages (described ) otherwise code fail. user can explicitly provide .Rprofile .Renviron file paths via r_profile r_environ arguments. example, following code attach .Rprofile found /man/scaffolding/ sub-directory current working directory. file simply uses praise package provide encouragement start new R session. However, noted , fails install_dependencies = FALSE.
code: four <- jetty::run(   \() 2 + 2,   r_profile = here::here("man/scaffolding/.Rprofile"),   install_dependencies = TRUE ) #> Installing package into ‘/usr/local/lib/R/site-library’ #> (as ‘lib’ is unspecified) #> trying URL 'https://r-lib.github.io/p/pak/stable/source/linux-gnu/aarch64/src/contrib/../../../../../linux/aarch64/pak_0.8.0_R-4-4_aarch64-linux.tar.gz' #> Content type 'application/gzip' length 8847947 bytes (8.4 MB) #> ================================================== #> downloaded 8.4 MB #>  #> * installing *binary* package ‘pak’ ... #> * DONE (pak) #>  #> The downloaded source packages are in #>  ‘/tmp/RtmpNxnaJk/downloaded_packages’ #> ✔ Updated metadata database: 3.07 MB in 8 files. #> ✔ Updating metadata database ... done #>   #> → Will install 1 package. #> → Will download 1 CRAN package (6.10 kB). #> + praise   1.0.0 [bld][dl] (6.10 kB) #>    #> ℹ Getting 1 pkg (6.10 kB) #> ✔ Got praise 1.0.0 (source) (6.10 kB) #> ℹ Building praise 1.0.0 #> ✔ Built praise 1.0.0 (403ms) #> ✔ Installed praise 1.0.0  (7ms) #> ✔ 1 pkg: added 1, dld 1 (6.10 kB) [3.8s] #> You are exquisite! four <- jetty::run(   \() 2 + 2,   r_profile = here::here("man/scaffolding/.Rprofile") ) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘praise’

previous_headings: Synchronous, one-off R processes in a Docker container > .Rprofile and .Renviron
title: Execute R in a Docker Context
text: Currently jetty supports single .Rprofile .Renviron files. , example, user project-specific .Rprofile current working directory ./.Rprofile user-specific .Rprofile ~/.Rprofile, jetty source ./.Rprofile ignore ~/.Rprofile. feature plan add long.

what: jetty: Execute R in a 'Docker' Context — jetty-package
title: jetty: Execute R in a 'Docker' Context — jetty-package
text: goal 'jetty' execute R functions code snippets isolated R subprocess within 'Docker' container return evaluated results local R session. 'jetty' can install necessary packages runtime seamlessly propagates errors outputs 'Docker' subprocess back main session. 'jetty' primarily designed sandboxed testing quick execution example code.

title: jetty: Execute R in a 'Docker' Context — jetty-package
text: Maintainer: Daniel Molitor molitdj97@gmail.com [copyright holder]

what: Execute an R expression inside a Docker container — run
title: Execute an R expression inside a Docker container — run
text: function somewhat similar spirit callr::r() user can pass function (code block) evaluated. code executed within context Docker container result returned within local R session.

title: Execute an R expression inside a Docker container — run
code: run(   func,   args = list(),   image = paste0("r-base:", r_version()),   stdout = "",   stderr = "",   install_dependencies = FALSE,   r_profile = file.path(getwd(), ".Rprofile"),   r_environ = file.path(getwd(), ".Renviron"),   debug = FALSE )

title: Execute an R expression inside a Docker container — run
text: func Function object code block executed R session within Docker container. best reference package functions using :: notation, packages installed Docker container accessible. args Arguments pass function. Must list. image string image:tag format specifying either local Docker image image available DockerHub. Default image r-base:{jetty:::r_version()} R version determined local R session. stdout, stderr output ‘stdout’ ‘stderr’ sent. Possible values "" (send R console; default), NULL FALSE (discard output), TRUE (capture output character vector) character string naming file. See system2 details. install_dependencies boolean indicating whether jetty discover packages used code try install Docker container prior executing provided function/expression. general, things work better Docker image already necessary packages installed. r_profile, r_environ Paths specifying jetty search .Rprofile .Renviron files transfer Docker sub-process. default jetty look files called ".Rprofile" ".Renviron" current working directory. either file found, transferred Docker sub-process loaded executing R commands. debug boolean indicating whether print commands executed via shell. mostly helpful see happening things start error.

title: Execute an R expression inside a Docker container — run
text: Value evaluated expression.

title: Execute an R expression inside a Docker container — run
text: important note side effects, e.g. plotting, may lost since screamed void Docker container. However, user full control 'stdterr' 'stdout' R sub-process running Docker container, side effects messages, warnings, printed output can directed console captured user. also crucial note actions local file system work jetty sub-processes. example, reading writing files /local file system fail since R sub-process within Docker container access local file system.

title: Execute an R expression inside a Docker container — run
text: jetty propagate errors Docker process main process. , error thrown Docker process, error message thrown main process. However, somewhat isolated nature local process Docker process, calling functions base::traceback() rlang::last_trace() print callstack uncaught error (current form) lost Docker void.

title: Execute an R expression inside a Docker container — run
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ run(   {     mtcars <- mtcars |>       transform(cyl = as.factor(cyl))     model <- lm(mpg ~ ., data = mtcars)     model   } )  # A code snippet that requires packages to be installed run(   {     mtcars <- mtcars |>        dplyr::mutate(cyl = as.factor(cyl))     model <- lm(mpg ~ ., data = mtcars)     model   },   install_dependencies = TRUE )  # This will error since the `praise` package is not installed run(function() praise::praise()) } # }

what: Execute an R script inside a Docker container — run_script
title: Execute an R script inside a Docker container — run_script
text: function somewhat similar spirit callr::rscript() user can specify R script executed within context Docker container.

title: Execute an R script inside a Docker container — run_script
code: run_script(   file,   ...,   context = dirname(file),   image = paste0("r-base:", r_version()),   stdout = "",   stderr = "",   install_dependencies = FALSE,   r_profile = file.path(getwd(), ".Rprofile"),   r_environ = file.path(getwd(), ".Renviron"),   debug = FALSE )

title: Execute an R script inside a Docker container — run_script
text: file character string giving pathname file read . ... Additional arguments passed directly source. context pathname directory serve execution context. directory mounted Docker container, means script access files/directories within context directory. context also serve working directory script executed. crucial note script able access files/directories outside scope context directory. default value directory file contained . image string image:tag format specifying either local Docker image image available DockerHub. Default image r-base:{jetty:::r_version()} R version determined local R session. stdout, stderr output ‘stdout’ ‘stderr’ sent. Possible values "" (send R console; default), NULL FALSE (discard output), TRUE (capture output character vector) character string naming file. See system2 details. install_dependencies boolean indicating whether jetty discover packages used code try install Docker container prior executing provided function/expression. general, things work better Docker image already necessary packages installed. r_profile, r_environ Paths specifying jetty search .Rprofile .Renviron files transfer Docker sub-process. default jetty look files called ".Rprofile" ".Renviron" current working directory. either file found, transferred Docker sub-process loaded executing R commands. debug boolean indicating whether print commands executed via shell. mostly helpful see happening things start error.

title: Execute an R script inside a Docker container — run_script
text: value last evaluated expression script.

title: Execute an R script inside a Docker container — run_script
text: *NOTE*: still pretty experimental. **** work Windows. made compatible MacOS Linux.

what: Interaction with the local file system
title: Execute an R script inside a Docker container — run_script
text: user asked specify context (local directory) executing R script. jetty mounts directory Docker container, allowing script interact files within (read/write). Attempts access files outside context directory cause script fail. Ensure context directory includes files needed script run.

title: Execute an R script inside a Docker container — run_script
text: run_script handle errors using mechanism run. See documentation details.

title: Execute an R script inside a Docker container — run_script
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Execute a simple script that has no package dependencies run_script(file = here::here("code/analysis_script.R"))  # Execute a script that needs access to the entire analysis directory run_script(   file = here::here("code/analysis_script.R"),   context = here::here() )  # Execute a script that needs access to the entire analysis directory # and relies on external packages run_script(   file = here::here("code/analysis_script.R"),   context = here::here(),   install_dependencies = TRUE ) } # }

title: jetty 0.2.0
text: Execute R script Docker container: jetty now supports executing R script Docker container via run_script() function. particularly important argument context argument. user specify filepath directory serves script’s execution context. Specifically, directory mounted Docker container , result, script access files/directories contained within context. script’s execution fail attempts interact files/directories outside provided context directory. Note: feature designed work well MacOS Linux likely crap used Windows.

title: jetty 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-01-09 Initial CRAN submission.
